channel.title: Browse through character files
channel.description: How do I make it so if I like type a command it'll search everyone's bank for a specific item?

item.title: Browse through character files
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

That is nowhere near what he wants to do, he wants to search through every character file in the Character Folder, like if a shop sells rigged items that he doesn’t know about and a bunch of people buy them, he either has to go through everyones bank one at a time, restart everyone, or get a command that searches through all the character files in the folder for the specific Item ID.

Read full topic

item.title: Browse through character files
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

Btw if you want to easily want to find your chracter in the character file then when your on that folder type in what name you want and it will automaticly select it.

Read full topic

item.title: Browse through character files
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Yep.

Try this method, it won’t do it exactly as I don’t want to program you a method for you, learn to do it yourself, but this should pretty much be it.

public void searchForItem(int item, File directory) { BufferedReader reader = null; if(directory.isDirectory()) { try { String[] files = directory.list(); for(int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) { reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(files[i])); String inFiles = new String(); while((inFiles = in.readline()) != null) { if(inFiles.contains(item)) { sendMessage(files[i] + " is found to contain the item ID"); } else { continue; } } } } catch(FileNotFoundException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } catch(IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } } else { sendMessage("Error, directory is not a directory."); } }
I typed that into the reply box, so it might have a few mistakes.
Then something like this for the command;

else if(command.startsWith("searchitem") && playerRights >= 3) { int item = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(10)); File directory = new File("./characters/"); searchForItem(item, directory); }

Read full topic

item.title: Browse through character files
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“ricky james, post:4, topic:158173”][quote author=dog eats dog link=topic=215590.msg1879692#msg1879692 date=1194929251]
Don’t need to, Go into Character folder, Look for the character you want to view bank, Then look for

[BANK]

Find the item Id of the item you want to see if he has.

Done.
[/quote]Dog 2000+ char files maybe your gonna have to search each bank which equals 3 hours at the least[/quote]

Good point, O well, Homerscape starts of with 200+ files, I found myself…Eventually.

Read full topic
